page.title: 10Traffic in Banwell
page.content: Nearly every edition of the local weekly paper has an article about Banwell's busy streets. Several people have been injured or badly shocked by near misses in West Street. A by-pass was suggested over 45 years ago and villagers are still campaigning for it! Hannah and I went down to the hall to count the cars, buses, lorries, vans and motor bikes. Ladies have also been counting how many lorries went onto the pavements so that cars going the other way can get by. There are sometimes traffic jams when I am coming to school because the cows or dustbin men are coming along the road. The survey conducted by Banwell School amazed everyone when it revealed that, between 8.45am and 3pm, 16,415 vehicles passed the school in only three days.
